title: SNOW PLOW VS SNOW PUSHER: WHICH ONE IS RIGHT FOR YOU?

tasks.task: Determine the better snow removal tool (snow pusher or plow) and discuss their pros and cons.
Compare snow pusher and plow prices.
subtasks: Note that snow pushers are generally cheaper than plows.
Mention varying prices based on model and options (e.g., 60, 72, 84, 96 inch widths for plows; 72 inch variant for Kubota L6060; options for manual vs. hydraulic angle on plows).

tasks.task: Evaluate snow pusher construction and features.
subtasks: Highlight Tar River snow pusher's robust design with beefy trip springs and skid shoes.
Mention replaceable edges and back drag options.
Discuss frame options and compatibility with different tractors (e.g., John Deere quick attach, Skidster, Global mounts).

tasks.task: Compare snow plow and pusher setup requirements.
subtasks: Note both tools require disconnecting existing front attachment (bucket, forks, grapple) and connecting to the loader.
Compare plow angle adjustment (manual vs. hydraulic) and operator control.

tasks.task: Analyze load carriage differences between pushers and plows.
subtasks: Explain pusher's even snow accumulation versus plow's off-center load.
Discuss plow's impact on steering and machine traction.
Both tools handle various snow conditions, but pushers may be more efficient on long driveways and large areas.
Mention windrow formation and clearing efficiency.

tasks.task: Conclude with the preference for snow pushers (due to simplicity and efficiency) but acknowledge individual needs.
subtasks: Recommend using pushers for long driveways and large areas.
Acknowledge the versatility of plows in other scenarios (e.g., narrow areas).
